case_vignette: A 65-year-old man presents with facial weakness. He says he noticed that his face appeared twisted when he looked in the bathroom mirror this morning. He is otherwise well and does not have any other complaints. He denies any facial pain or paresthesia. No significant past medical history. The patient is afebrile and vital signs are within normal limits. Neurological examination reveals difficulty shutting the right eye tight and inability to bring up the right corner of his mouth when asked to smile. Remainder of the exam, including the left side of the face, is unremarkable.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
My face appeared twisted when I looked in the mirror this morning, and I'm having trouble closing my right eye tightly and moving up the right corner of my mouth when I try to smile.
Have you experienced any weakness in your arms or legs?
No, I haven't experienced any weakness in my arms or legs.
Have these symptoms appeared suddenly or developed gradually?
They appeared suddenly this morning.
Do you have any pain around your ear, jaw, or in the back of your head on the affected side?
No, I don't have any facial pain or pain around my ear, jaw, or in the back of my head.
Have you had any recent illness, like a cold or flu, or any rashes such as shingles on your face?
No, I haven't had any recent illness or rashes like shingles on my face.
Have you noticed any changes in your taste, or have you been experiencing excessive tearing or dryness in your right eye?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in my taste or experienced excessive tearing or dryness in my right eye.
Have you experienced any hearing changes recently, like hearing more acutely in one ear?
No, I haven't experienced any changes in my hearing.
Are you currently taking any medications, or have you started any new medications recently?
No, I'm not currently taking any medications and haven't started any new ones recently.
Is there any history of neurological disorders in your family?
No, there's no significant past medical history.
Final Diagnosis: Bell's palsy.
